recipe_name: Roasted maple oranges with French toast and cream
author: James Tanner
method: Beat together the eggs, milk and sugar in a bowl. Dip the slices of bread into the liquid, allowing it to soak in well. Heat the butter in a frying pan and fry the egg-soaked bread until golden-brown on both sides, about two minutes per side. Heat the maple syrup in a small saucepan and add the orange segments. Warm through for 2-3 minutes. Serve the French toast on a serving plate with the oranges and maple syrup spooned over the top. Serve drizzled with cream, dusted with icing sugar and garnished with chopped mint.
ingredients: 2 free-range eggs, beaten,  150ml/5fl oz whole milk,  1 tbsp caster sugar,  2 slices white bread,  25g/1oz butter,  2 tbsp maple syrup,  1 orange, segmented,  2 tbsp double cream,  icing sugar,  1 tsp chopped fresh mint
